SEARCH
Package networking.client

Class ServerHandler

java.lang.Object
networking.client.ServerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ServerHandler extends Object implements Runnable
Represents a handler for communication with the Othello game server.

It implements the Runnable interface to handle communication in a separate thread.

Version:
1.0, 12/07/2023
Author:
Dinh Thuy Nhat Vy
See Also:
  • OthelloClient
  • ProtocolException
  • ServerUnavailableException

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerHandler

      public ServerHandler(Socket socket, OthelloClient client) throws IOException
      Constructs a ServerHandler instance with the given socket and client.
      Parameters:
      socket - the socket for communication with the server.
      client - the Othello client associated with this handler.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the handler.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the server handler, continuously reading and processing server output.

      Handles various exceptions that may occur during communication.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • sendInputToServer

      public void sendInputToServer(String userInput) throws ServerUnavailableException
      Sends user input to the server.
      Parameters:
      userInput - the user's input to be sent to the server.
      Throws:
      ServerUnavailableException - if the server is currently unavailable.

    • handleServerCommand

      private void handleServerCommand(String receivedCommand) throws ProtocolException, ServerUnavailableException
      Handles a server command by interpreting and processing the received command.
      Parameters:
      receivedCommand - the command received from the server.
      Throws:
      ProtocolException - if the server sends an unknown or invalid command.
      ServerUnavailableException - if the server is currently unavailable.

    • clearConnection

      public void clearConnection() throws IOException
      Closes the connection by closing the reader, writer, and socket.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while closing the connection.
